meanings.definition: A person who is hopeful or optimistic.
meanings.sent1: The group of hopefuls gathered together to share their dreams.
meanings.sent2: The hopefuls in the room all had smiles on their faces.
meanings.sent3: The hopefuls decided to have a race to see who could reach the finish line first.
meanings.sent4: The field was filled with hopefuls, each one believing they could win the competition.
meanings.sent5: The young hopefuls looked up at the stars, imagining all the possibilities ahead.

meanings.definition: Candidates or contestants with a chance of success.
meanings.sent1: The hopefuls prepared for the final round of the competition.
meanings.sent2: Among the hopefuls, there was a sense of anticipation and excitement.
meanings.sent3: The hopefuls lined up for the audition, each one eager to showcase their talent.
meanings.sent4: The group of hopefuls stood nervously on stage, waiting for the results to be announced.
meanings.sent5: The hopefuls practiced diligently, hoping to impress the judges with their skills.
